Operation 'get_/{year}/{month}.json' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Archive API' is too generic and doesn't describe the operation's action. Description lacks specificity about parameter formats, return structure details, and doesn't clearly indicate the operation retrieves historical article data. Enhanced version specifies parameter formats, clarifies the return value contains article metadata, and reinforces the use case for AI agent decision-making about when to invoke this operation.

data.current_description: The Archive API provides lists of NYT articles by month going back to 1851.  Simply pass in the year and month you want and it returns a JSON object with all articles for that month.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve NYT articles by year and month
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of New York Times articles published in a specified month and year, dating back to 1851. Accepts year (YYYY format) and month (MM format) as path parameters. Returns a JSON object containing article metadata including headlines, bylines, abstracts, and other document properties. Useful for building local databases of NYT article metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Archive API' is too generic and doesn't describe the operation's action. Enhanced version specifies parameter formats, clarifies the return value contains article metadata, and reinforces the use case for AI agent decision-making about when to invoke this operation.
